node.category: What is the way things are?
What is the situation with alternative treatments?

node.surface: Health insurance companies should naturally cover alternative medical treatments.
Not all practices and approaches that are lumped together under this term may have been proven in clinical trials,

node.category: Do these practices and approaches work?

node.surface: yet it's precisely their positive effect when accompanying conventional 'western' medical therapies that's been demonstrated as beneficial.
Besides many general practitioners offer such counselling and treatments in parallel anyway -

node.category: Are the practitioners to be questioned?

node.surface: and who would want to question their broad expertise?
